title: (x) square sans serif used in ESPN magazine - various similar {gang}
content:
Does anyone recognize this font?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023002327im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ESPN%20mag%20type%20sampleB.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Heavy Gothic wood type - Chikamauga, Champion Gothic {Mike F, Tiff}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023002327/http:/typophile.com/node/18767 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) black sans type - Gill Kayo Cond {David H, Erik} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023002327/http:/typophile.com/node/18788 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kwebb

comments.content: Don’t know this one. Consider [FF Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023002327/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=6&displayfontid=FF.6184.0.0&fontRendererText=GOING+BATTY), [Gagarin](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023002327/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=14&displayfontid=TB.116949.0.0&fontRendererText=GOING+BATTY), [Refrigerator](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023002327/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=3&displayfontid=MSF.118752.0.0&fontRendererText=GOING+BATTY), or [Stratum](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023002327/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=6&displayfontid=PRC.118813.0.0&fontRendererText=GOING+BATTY).

[Refrigerator](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023002327/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=3&displayfontid=MSF.118752.0.0&fontRendererText=GOING+BATTY)sure is nice.

[Industria](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023002327/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/industria/solid/testdrive.html) and [Agency FB](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023002327/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/fb-agency/agencyfb-bold/testdrive.html) is also similar.
Another to consider: [Liquorstore](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023002327/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/liquorstore/) from Chank Diesel.
This one is very close. Thanks for the suggestion.
